definition: to stop work for the day (generally of laborers)/to knock off
to receive/to accept/to collect/to put away/to restrain/to stop/in care of (used on address line after name)

sentences.english: They started work early and finished late every day.
sentences.chinese: 他们每天上工早收工晚。

sentences.english: By the time he's done with work, their plans are ruined, so they spend the night together in the museum.
sentences.chinese: 收工后原计划泡汤，他们在博物馆度过了浪漫的一夜。

sentences.english: We knock off work in time for tea.
sentences.chinese: 我们收工后，正好能赶上喝下午茶。

sentences.english: "I removed them all, "the doctor declared. "We'll close now. "
sentences.chinese: 我把所有的药棉都取出了，我们现在可以收工了。

sentences.english: Every evening after work, I run along the sea front near vanier park.
sentences.chinese: 每天傍晚收工后，我就沿着凡尼尔公园边的海岸长跑。

definition: to finish work/to get off work
to go to work/to start work
to get out of bed/to get up
in the evening/when night falls/towards evening/at night fall/at dusk
midnight/in the middle of the night
